item.title: Multi-Agent systems and their tendency to develop alzheimers
item.description:
The Multi-Agent Bottleneck Nobody’s Solved

What’s currently top of mind for me:

I had a conversation with Ahmed Ghaddah last week that fundamentally changed how I think about multi-agent systems.

He walked me through how these systems work in real production enterprise environments. Not just basic problem solving. But realistic value-adding workflows that automate tasks which would’ve taken a human days or weeks.

The coordination mechanisms. The failure modes. The places where things break at scale.
